context: I'm sure it won't but will this fit with a plastic case already around a 3DS XL? Please only answer if you know. Thank you.
response: It's a pretty tight fit around just the 3DS.

context: Every time I try to use the profile editor it keeps saying this "Plug in the device you wish to configure and run the program again." what do I do?
response: Well I finally despaired and just put it in the bin...

context: can you hear your own voice in the headset while chatting?
response: As in being played back through the speakers? That would only happen if you have your Microphone turned to "Always Listening" in the Windows Audio settings.

context: Does the game have Elvis the King slot machine game on it?
response: I don't know.didn't open for me.

context: What does it mean:   "Does not allow Original Xbox game compatibility".
response: The original X box 360 has a hard drive that clips in on top. The new slim 360 hard drive slides into the side panel.

context: Will this work for non-racing-sim games, like Euro Truck Simulator 2?
response: Yeah, I play ETS2 with it. Just set the controls as you wish in the settings

context: how do i patch the pc version?
response: Patch should automatically load through Valve's Steam, which is the equivalent of EA's Origin.

context: Does can I play this game against someone else? (In the same room-not online) Thanks.
response: Yes. It has two player co op or versus offline

context: Is this game at all appropriate for a 13 yo boy? My son is begging me for this, and it doesnt seem appropriate IMO.
response: Yes and No, because there is inappropriate stuff like guns and killing but, I can see that your child wants this because it's fun. Just tell him to not do inappropriate stuff,

context: Is this controller compatible with Wii U also?
response: Nintendo just announced an official adapter today! Release date pending... http://kotaku.com/nintendo-made-a-gamecube-controller-adapter-for-wii-u-1583342868

context: Can I play Japanese games on this? Because the Japanese version can only play games from Japan... So I don't know if it's the same with this.
response: You cannot play Japanese games in U.S. 3DS.

context: Is this just one piece or is there a rubber attached to each piece that is removable?
response: They are one piece, no rubber.  Unlike the original ones there is no rubber coating on the top of the stick, they are one solid price of hard plastic

context: Do you need an internet connection to play this game?
response: yes, you must be connected to internet. any game that shows DVD usually needs internet to work. get the ones that show CD and they will work off line or online. some games will play if you leave the disc in your computer

context: How many GBs is this console?
response: 32GB, just like the deluxe version. About 3GB is used by the system, but you still get about 29GB

context: can in work with Win8?
response: I am not sure. I run Win 7. Suggest you use forums to find answer.

context: How is this mouse for fingertip grip? Isn't the thumb area too narrow of a space with the buttons and the rest taking too much space?
response: I bought it as a gift, so I can't speak from lots of experience but it didn't seem to bad for a fingertip grip when I tried it out. I didn't really know where to put my thumb at first but it's not that much of a change in style for me to complain about it.

context: how many players can play at a time?
response: On one system? You can have up to four people playing. Ultimate online season can only have one person playing though unless you do a single player season instead of online.

context: How can I be sure I have a version that will let me play off-line. Mine still says on the box that "persistent internet connection required"
response: That is because EA never updated the box art they simply updated the game files to support offline, u should have no problem playing off lineIf u do just update the game

context: Does this work with Linux?
response: Yes, however, RAT profile does not load automatically and speed of mouse is bad

context: Is that a 7th button in the middle of the 6 side buttons or is it just a nub for resting your thumb.
response: It is just a nub for resting your thumb.

context: what is the difference between card and online game code?
response: I honestly got this on sale, but there is no difference the sale is the only reason I bought it here .

context: does this fit the new 3ds xl?
response: Yes it fitMe and my grandson love itIt's not as bulky as it looks on the pic

context: do these head phones actually allow you to hear the game play audio or just voice chat ?
response: Both. The downside is the batteries last for about 12 hours. The upside is you hear everything!

context: Does this work when playing games on the Wii Shop Channel?
response: Honestly I don't recommend getting this one. It ended up being a cheap knockoff of a Wii Controller and the buttons stopped working within like a month and got sticky.

context: Can I play it in spanish language?
response: I think there is a Add-On that you can Download from the PlayStation store that allows you to have Spanish speaking announcers in game.

context: is there free roam
response: Yes.  If you are not in the middle of a level you can freely roam. You can explore the Shire, Bree and many other way points.

context: is this the full version game or is this just the online code that I need to play this game.
response: This is the online code that you will need to unlock the game on the Steam platform. You will need to open a Steam account (free) and login to play. You will need an internet connection each time.

context: If I buy this as a used item, will the downloadable game have expired before I can play it?
response: No, the item does not include the download code.

context: Had a Razer Naga MMO mouse...it died after a year.  Any suggestions on what should I buy from Logitech to replace it?
response: Logitech G600 is a similar model, but I didn't used it, so I don't nothing to say about it.

context: does this work for the ps4?
response: Yes but it is still a piece of crap

context: Hey guys I was wondering how quiet this mouse is? Are the clicks very loud at night? thx
response: If you're using the mouse in the same room as a light sleeper, the clicks may disturb him/her.  They're not particularly loud -- I'd rate the click noise as a bit below average for mice.

context: Is this for a 13 year old beginner?
response: All ages can play this game. When in game play the game will adjust it's difficulty automatically  to a level comfortable enough for the player.

context: Are these headphones wireless?
response: Diane, no they are not. I specifically bought them for that reason because I have heard from owners of wireless headphones that the battery does not last that long and in order to keep using them after the battery dies, you have to buy another battery (which aren't cheap). Hope this helped.

context: Do the pedals work properly if I plug them in the Saitek Pro Yoke instead of my PC? I have a shortage of USB ports in my PC.
response: Yes that's how I have them hooked up
